segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Credential Validation, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events on credentials that are submitted for a user account logon request.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit Credential Validation, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events on credentials that are submitted for a user account logon request.

segment.source: Audit Credential Validation determines whether the operating system generates audit events on credentials that are submitted for a user account logon request.
segment.target: Audit Credential Validation determines whether the operating system generates audit events on credentials that are submitted for a user account logon request.

segment.source: These events occur on the computer that is authoritative for the credentials as follows:
segment.target: These events occur on the computer that is authoritative for the credentials as follows:

segment.source: For domain accounts, the domain controller is authoritative.
segment.target: For domain accounts, the domain controller is authoritative.

segment.source: For local accounts, the local computer is authoritative.
segment.target: For local accounts, the local computer is authoritative.

segment.source: Low on member servers and workstations.
segment.target: Low on member servers and workstations.

segment.source: Because domain accounts are used much more frequently than local accounts in enterprise environments, most of the Account Logon events in a domain environment occur on the domain controllers that are authoritative for the domain accounts.
segment.target: Because domain accounts are used much more frequently than local accounts in enterprise environments, most of the Account Logon events in a domain environment occur on the domain controllers that are authoritative for the domain accounts.

segment.source: However, these events can occur on any computer, and they may occur in conjunction with or on separate computers from Logon and Logoff events.
segment.target: However, these events can occur on any computer, and they may occur in conjunction with or on separate computers from Logon and Logoff events.

segment.source: The main reason to enable this auditing subcategory is to handle local accounts authentication attempts and, for domain accounts, NTLM authentication in the domain.
segment.target: The main reason to enable this auditing subcategory is to handle local accounts authentication attempts and, for domain accounts, NTLM authentication in the domain.

segment.source: It is especially useful for monitoring unsuccessful attempts, to find brute-force attacks, account enumeration, and potential account compromise events on domain controllers.
segment.target: It is especially useful for monitoring unsuccessful attempts, to find brute-force attacks, account enumeration, and potential account compromise events on domain controllers.

segment.source: Expected volume of events is high for domain controllers, because this subcategory will generate events when an authentication attempt is made using any domain account and NTLM authentication.
segment.target: Expected volume of events is high for domain controllers, because this subcategory will generate events when an authentication attempt is made using any domain account and NTLM authentication.

segment.source: IF – We recommend Success auditing to keep track of domain-account authentication events using the NTLM protocol.
segment.target: IF – We recommend Success auditing to keep track of domain-account authentication events using the NTLM protocol.

segment.source: Expect a high volume of events.
segment.target: Expect a high volume of events.

segment.source: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.
segment.target: For recommendations for using and analyzing the collected information, see the Security Monitoring Recommendations sections.

segment.source: Just collecting Success auditing events in this subcategory for future use in case of a security incident is not very useful, because events in this subcategory are not always informative.
segment.target: Just collecting Success auditing events in this subcategory for future use in case of a security incident is not very useful, because events in this subcategory are not always informative.

segment.source: We recommend Failure auditing, to collect information about failed authentication attempts using domain accounts and the NTLM authentication protocol.
segment.target: We recommend Failure auditing, to collect information about failed authentication attempts using domain accounts and the NTLM authentication protocol.

segment.source: Expected volume of events is low for member servers, because this subcategory will generate events when an authentication attempt is made using a local account, which should not happen too often.
segment.target: Expected volume of events is low for member servers, because this subcategory will generate events when an authentication attempt is made using a local account, which should not happen too often.

segment.source: We recommend Success auditing, to keep track of authentication events by local accounts.
segment.target: We recommend Success auditing, to keep track of authentication events by local accounts.

segment.source: We recommend Failure auditing, to collect information about failed authentication attempts by local accounts.
segment.target: We recommend Failure auditing, to collect information about failed authentication attempts by local accounts.

segment.source: Expected volume of events is low for workstations, because this subcategory will generate events when an authentication attempt is made using a local account, which should not happen too often.
segment.target: Expected volume of events is low for workstations, because this subcategory will generate events when an authentication attempt is made using a local account, which should not happen too often.

segment.source: We recommend Success auditing, to keep track of authentication events by local accounts.
segment.target: We recommend Success auditing, to keep track of authentication events by local accounts.

segment.source: We recommend Failure auditing, to collect information about failed authentication attempts by local accounts.
segment.target: We recommend Failure auditing, to collect information about failed authentication attempts by local accounts.

segment.source: 4774(S): An account was mapped for logon.
segment.target: 4774(S): An account was mapped for logon.

segment.source: 4775(F): An account could not be mapped for logon.
segment.target: 4775(F): An account could not be mapped for logon.

segment.source: 4776(S, F): The computer attempted to validate the credentials for an account.
segment.target: 4776(S, F): The computer attempted to validate the credentials for an account.

segment.source: 4777(F): The domain controller failed to validate the credentials for an account.
segment.target: 4777(F): The domain controller failed to validate the credentials for an account.
